IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION IS A CALIFORNIA NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION WHICH SPONSORS AND MANAGES, THROUGH AFFILIATED AND UNAFFILIATED CORPORATIONS, AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR VERY LOW INCOME SENIOR ADULTS THROUGHOUT THE LOS ANGELES AREA. ADDITIONALLY, MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION OWNS AND OPERATES MENORAH HOUSE, A 51-UNIT HOUSING COMPLEX THAT PROVIDES AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR VERY LOW INCOME ELDERLY IN LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Menorah Housing Foundation is a California not-for-profit corporation which sponsors and manages, through affiliated and unaffiliated corporations, affordable housing for senior adults throughout the Los Angeles area. Additionally, MHF owns and operates Menorah House, a 51-unit housing complex that provides affordable housing for the elderly in Los Angeles, California.
IRS990.Description: MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION OWNS AND OPERATES MENORAH HOUSE, A 51-UNIT HOUSING COMPLEX PROVIDING AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR VERY LOW INCOME ELDERLY IN LOS ANGELES, CA.

Activity2.Description: MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION PROVIDES PROPERTY MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR NON-PROFIT HUD SUBSIDIZED HOUSING PROJECTS FOR LOW AND VERY LOW INCOME ELDERLY AND DEVELOPS LOW INCOME HOUSING FOR VERY LOW INCOME SENIOR CITIZENS.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: Schedule A, Part III, Line 12: Miscellaneous income consists of tenant charges, laundry and vending charges and other income items for services provided for the convenience of the tenants.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: In 2009, the Corporation adopted the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 740, which provides guidance for how uncertain income tax positions should be recognized, measured, presented and disclosed in the financial statements. The Corporation is required to evaluate the income tax positions taken or expected to be taken to determine whether the positions are "more-likely-than-not" to be sustained upon examination by the applicable tax authority. The Corporation has determined that the application of the Income Taxes standard does not impact the operations of the Corporation and that no provision for income tax is required in the Corporation's financial statements. There has been no interest or penalties recognized in the income statement or balance sheet for the years ended August 31, 2010 and 2009. As of August 31,2010, the following federal and state tax years remain open: August 31, 2006, 2007, 2008, and 2009.
Revenue from Noble Senior Housing, L.P.: 14.
Net loss on investment in Noble senior housing, l.p.: 331.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: to assist in providing low and very low income housing as approved by hud.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: grants and contributions are awarded to related parties to help with the overall mission of low and very low income housing. the related organizations are all audited entities that are subject to the rules and regulations of hud.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: subject to the provisions of the california nonprofit public benefit corporation law and subject to any limitations in the articles of incorporation and these by-laws, the business and affairs of the corporation shall be managed and all corporate powers shall be exercised by or under the direction of its board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDITING FIRM SENDS A DRAFT OF THE RETURN TO THE COMPANY. THE COMPANY FORWARDS A COPY OF THE RETURN TO EACH BOARD MEMBER FOR THEIR COMMENTS PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: board members sign off on the policy annually and abstain from any voting where a conflict could exist.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process includes all of these elements: (1) review and approval by the Board of Directors or compensation committee of the Organization; (2) use of data as to comparable compensation; and (3) contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping. 1. Review and Approval. The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved by the Board of Directors or compensation committee of the Organization, provided that persons with conflicts of interest with respect to the compensation arrangement at issue are not involved in this review and approval. 2. Use of data as to comparable compensation. The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved using data as to comparable compensation for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations. 3. Contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping. There is contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping with respect to the deliberations and decisions regarding the compensation arrangement.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the form 990 and all related financial and policy information are made available to the public upon written request.

the company receives a copy of the audit. prior to the finalization of the audit. a copy of the audit is given to all of the board members for their comments. when the audit is up for bid, the board discusses the relationship with the current auditors and makes a determination as to whether to maintain this relationship or change to a new auditing firm.

MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION IS THE MANAGEMENT COMPANY AND EMPLOYS THE INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK AT THE PROJECTS. THE PROJECTS REIMBURSE THE FOUNDATION FOR THE EMPLOYEE'S SALARIES AND OTHER COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THEIR EMPLOYMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: due to limitation of the number of lines on schedule L, part iv, not all of the board members and key employees are being shown on page one of schedule L.
